column1: Abu Ma'shar al-Balkhi, Latinized as Albumasar (10 August 787 - 9 March 886, [1] 171-272), was an early Persian Muslim astrologer, thought to be the greatest astrologer of the [2] court in [3].
column5: While he was not a major innovator, his practical manuals for training astrologers profoundly influenced Muslim intellectual history and, through translations, that of western Europe and Byzantium.

column1: The ancient Persians were originally an ancient Iranian people who had migrated to the region of [1] (corresponding to the modern-day Iranian province of [2]) by the 9th century BCE.
